intro: Hulsea vestita subsp. parryi, commonly known as the Parry's hulsea, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Cistaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers clustered in racemes. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Hulsea vestita subsp. parryi is adapted to withstand drought and full sun exposure.
